page.title: 02HISTORY OF THE MILTON AREA.
page.content: New stone age graves 3kms west,a bronze age burial kist found in 1957 at Ashgrove,Methilhill,the hill fort of Maiden Castle,Kennoway,Roman coins found near Milton and the ruins of a Culdee Church in Methil Cemetery,tell us our local history.Forests and marshes covered the area.Later,Danes then Normans came,and{farming}was important.Small{coalmines}operated. Villages grew up beside the River Leven.Derivations of{place names}tell us Leven was'elm tree',Balgonie,'place of the stirks'(yearling male calves)or 'place of the smiths' and Methil,'soft marshy ground'.Kennoway was 'head of the plain',Cameron,'a crooked gap' and Buckhaven,'a rocky harbour'.Next,corn and flax spinning mills along the river increased the population.Milton means 'mill town'.Windygates was at the junction of village roads.
